Articles.Content:
In an attempt to befriend the beast, I made a lanky robotic octopus and fired it into deep space. Turs out, large spindly ships tend to make the Kraken very very angry. Just outside of kerbin orbit the Kraken grabbed it and started spinning it around wildly until it exploded.

Your challenge, should you choose to accept it, is to build a ship which angers the kraken as much as possible.

you ship must spontaneously explode due to kraken effects at the lowest possible velocity.

you must be outside the atmosphere, to rule out drag as the cause of failure (success?)

please include a pic of your craft in orbit

I'll enter my ship when I get home to my other computer.

Edited August 21, 2012 by nhnifong

It is clear to me that the Kraken attempted to mate with your ship.

You should be flattered.
Ok, both them posts made me laugh, a lot. I wounder what I can stier up in my pot of strange.

I was trying to make a fast cart and instead got a cart that angers the kraken at 0m/s

Here is the craft file if anyone wants a cart that spins and flips randomly as soon as the physics load.

https://dl.dropbox.com/u/101339462/Kraken%20Cart.craft

I landed a Kethane rig on the Mun, mined converted etc., flew to another ship at an arch to refuel it so it could return to Kerbin. While Bob was on EVA (he said something about draining a hose) the ship sprang into the air like startled gazelle...

and proceeded to roll end over end down the hill, leaving a trail of debris...

Despite a valiant attempt by Jeb to wrest control of the stricken (and possibly possessed) vessel, the Krakens grip was too strong...

Fortunately, all the crew survived and picked themselves up to scavenge what they need to survive until rescue arrives...

Oh, and for the record that was at 0m/s and wasnt even the active flight at the time. Perhaps the Kraken feeds on kethane and upon seeing the rig thought "Ooo, just how I like it! Crunchy on the outside, with a chewy centre"

Edited August 29, 2012 by Binky
damn spoiler tags...
this is an insanely silly thread. i like it!
FUNNY A LOT FUNNY ill make the kraken so angery it might blow up :3 ill send a robotic octopus and see if he/she likes it unmaned due to i left kerbs on the mun and im runing out of kerbs

I was trying to make a fast cart and instead got a cart that angers the kraken at 0m/s

Oh gosh, that thing is HILARIOUS!

I Present to you

Takes me about 3 min to exit the atmosphere and 4 min to have an sun orbit calculation

additonaly i have reached the sun in this ship (proceding to touch it rather then pass it)

Too funny! I'm still laughing quietly at my desk, trying not to attract attention.

"Anger the Kraken" strikes me as the KSP analogue of "Taste the Rainbow", but explodier!

Edited August 30, 2012 by pebble_garden

Well, I accidentally made a house.

As it turns out, flying it is a little difficult.

I had to use Mechjeb's SURF and 50% throttle to get into the upper atmosphere, but from there on it was relatively simple. I decided to shoot for the Mun, and had actually gotten within a few hundred kilometers at around 2500m/s when the entire craft started jittering. Sadly, puush failed to take my screenshots - I probably hit the wrong key combo in panic. Anyway, the entire thing peeled right in half, but seeming as I have no post-kraken screenshots, I don't know whether this will count.

Edit: I actually flew the craft twice with the same results - but for the test flight I had Debug enabled, to see if it was even CAPABLE of orbiting.

KSP locked up a few times, resumed, and then this happened.

Edited August 30, 2012 by flaillomanz

HERES THE BADEST THING YOU DONE.I flying to the north pole my plane broke up in 1,000 feet but the kraken didn't know that i had a parachute i landed safely on the north pole the rescue craft came and got back to KSC bob kerman did not knew what the hell got wrong i blame the space kraken or the ship heres my kerman freaked the hell out of him.[ATTACH=CONFIG]32236[/ATTACH][ATTACH=CONFIG]32237[/ATTACH]

These are all amusign stories, but a lot of people seem to be referencing the kraken at any rocket failure here. The kraken specifically refers to explosion effects at high speeds! Therefore, those 0 speed exlosions are something else entirely

These are all amusign stories, but a lot of people seem to be referencing the kraken at any rocket failure here. The kraken specifically refers to explosion effects at high speeds! Therefore, those 0 speed exlosions are something else entirely

Hummm so your saying Lockness or the Lusca? something else ?
lol i think the kraken though i was a fish :3 and bit it so thats why i broke up LOL
the kraken well it umm... every thing that was in orbit around the mun got put in to orbit around the sun

I once had a rocket with 3 arms extending out from the centre, built it to test the stability of a rocket likthat. When it took off, it started jerking every 5 seconds, each time with a G force of more than 10. Was it the kraken?

I once put one of my MJ-1 MechJeb satellites on Mun orbit, but later as I was doing a long-term solar escape trajectory mission with another rocket I found that the same satellite was in a solar orbit. Kraken, perhaps?
I kind of angered the kraken. I accelerated to over 9000m/s in Kerbin orbit. The rocket ended up inside the Mun moments later but the map said I would not even pass near the mun.

This is classic kraken right here, in an autoorbit 100km circular orbit.

http://imgur.com/a/myyAD#0

heh, i think i've angered the kraken with my vehicle dubbed, "mun tank"... i've flown it to the mun twice now, and both times it makes the trip successfully, only to flip rediculously fast at very low speeds.

it's worth noting that i'm using the gravisapa to get the 8 wheeled monstrosity there, but once on the surface, i didnt use any of the functions of the gravisapa. (pics to come soon... didnt think to take any...)

I was in a Large orbit with Jool, and I was going to shrink it. But then when I reached the apoapsis the entire ship fell apart and my only strategy to get a closer look was that I let out one of the Kermans and I used all his jet pack fuel to get the orbit down to 114 million kilometers. BUT the orbit looked very beautiful. Maybe at some point In will take a picture of the stranded kerman.
Isn't the Kraken dead as of 0.17?

Isn't the Kraken dead as of 0.17?

It is, you can find it's corpse on one of Jool's (I think) moons, but now we have the Deep Space Cthulhu to deal with
